Events.text: Battle of Augsburg: The Hungarians defeat the East Frankish army under King Louis the Child, using the famous feigned retreat tactic of the nomadic warriors.
Events.html: Battle of Augsburg: The Hungarians defeat the East Frankish army under King Louis the Child, using the famous feigned retreat tactic of the nomadic warriors.

Events.text: At the instigation of Louis IX of France, an inter-faith debate, known as the Disputation of Paris, starts between a Christian monk and four rabbis.
Events.html: At the instigation of Louis IX of France, an inter-faith debate, known as the Disputation of Paris, starts between a Christian monk and four rabbis.

Events.text: Peasants' Revolt: In England, rebels arrive at Blackheath.
Events.html: Peasants' Revolt: In England, rebels arrive at Blackheath.

Events.text: Armagnac–Burgundian Civil War: Parisians slaughter Bernard VII, Count of Armagnac and his suspected sympathizers, along with all prisoners, foreign bankers, and students and faculty of the College of Navarre.
Events.html: Armagnac–Burgundian Civil War: Parisians slaughter Bernard VII, Count of Armagnac and his suspected sympathizers, along with all prisoners, foreign bankers, and students and faculty of the College of Navarre.

Events.text: Hundred Years' War: Joan of Arc leads the French army in their capture of the city and the English commander, William de la Pole, 1st Duke of Suffolk in the second day of the Battle of Jargeau.
Events.html: Hundred Years' War: Joan of Arc leads the French army in their capture of the city and the English commander, William de la Pole, 1st Duke of Suffolk in the second day of the Battle of Jargeau.

links.title: William de la Pole, 1st Duke of Suffolk

Events.text: The city of Helsinki, Finland (belonging to Sweden at the time) is founded by King Gustav I of Sweden.
Events.html: The city of Helsinki, Finland (belonging to Sweden at the time) is founded by King Gustav I of Sweden.

Events.text: First Anglo-Dutch War: The Battle of the Gabbard begins and lasts until June 13.
Events.html: First Anglo-Dutch War: The Battle of the Gabbard begins and lasts until June 13.

Events.text: England installs a municipal government in New York City (the former Dutch settlement of New Amsterdam).
Events.html: England installs a municipal government in New York City (the former Dutch settlement of New Amsterdam).

Events.text: French and Indian War: Siege of Louisbourg: James Wolfe's attack at Louisbourg, Nova Scotia commences.
Events.html: French and Indian War: Siege of Louisbourg: James Wolfe's attack at Louisbourg, Nova Scotia commences.

Events.text: French explorer Marc-Joseph Marion du Fresne and 25 of his men killed by Māori in New Zealand
Events.html: French explorer Marc-Joseph Marion du Fresne and 25 of his men killed by Māori in New Zealand

Events.text: American Revolution: British general Thomas Gage declares martial law in Massachusetts. The British offer a pardon to all colonists who lay down their arms. There would be only two exceptions to the amnesty: Samuel Adams and John Hancock, if captured, were to be hanged.
Events.html: American Revolution: British general Thomas Gage declares martial law in Massachusetts. The British offer a pardon to all colonists who lay down their arms. There would be only two exceptions to the amnesty: Samuel Adams and John Hancock, if captured, were to be hanged.

Events.text: The Virginia Declaration of Rights is adopted.
Events.html: The Virginia Declaration of Rights is adopted.

Events.text: Irish Rebellion of 1798: Battle of Ballynahinch.
Events.html: Irish Rebellion of 1798: Battle of Ballynahinch.

Events.text: maiden ride by Karl von Drais of the bicycle.
Events.html: maiden ride by Karl von Drais of the bicycle.

Events.text: American Civil War, Overland Campaign: Battle of Cold Harbor: Ulysses S. Grant gives the Confederate forces under Robert E. Lee a victory when he pulls his Union troops from their position at Cold Harbor, Virginia and moves south.
Events.html: American Civil War, Overland Campaign: Battle of Cold Harbor: Ulysses S. Grant gives the Confederate forces under Robert E. Lee a victory when he pulls his Union troops from their position at Cold Harbor, Virginia and moves south.

Events.text: Philippine Declaration of Independence: General Emilio Aguinaldo declares the Philippines' independence from Spain.
Events.html: Philippine Declaration of Independence: General Emilio Aguinaldo declares the Philippines' independence from Spain.

Events.text: New Richmond tornado: The eighth deadliest tornado in U.S. history kills 117 people and injures around 200.
Events.html: New Richmond tornado: The eighth deadliest tornado in U.S. history kills 117 people and injures around 200.

Events.text: Massacre of Phocaea: Turkish irregulars slaughter 50 to 100 Greeks and expel thousands of others in an ethnic cleansing operation in the Ottoman Empire.
Events.html: Massacre of Phocaea: Turkish irregulars slaughter 50 to 100 Greeks and expel thousands of others in an ethnic cleansing operation in the Ottoman Empire.

Events.text: A ceasefire is negotiated between Bolivia and Paraguay, ending the Chaco War
Events.html: A ceasefire is negotiated between Bolivia and Paraguay, ending the Chaco War

Events.text: Shooting begins on Paramount Pictures' Dr. Cyclops, the first horror film photographed in three-strip Technicolor.
Events.html: Shooting begins on Paramount Pictures' Dr. Cyclops, the first horror film photographed in three-strip Technicolor.

Events.text: The Baseball Hall of Fame opens in Cooperstown, New York.
Events.html: 1939 – The Baseball Hall of Fame opens in Cooperstown, New York.

Events.text: World War II: Thirteen thousand British and French troops surrender to Major General Erwin Rommel at Saint-Valery-en-Caux.
Events.html: World War II: Thirteen thousand British and French troops surrender to Major General Erwin Rommel at Saint-Valery-en-Caux.

Events.text: Anne Frank receives a diary for her thirteenth birthday.
Events.html: Anne Frank receives a diary for her thirteenth birthday.

Events.text: Holocaust: Germany liquidates the Jewish Ghetto in Brzeżany, Poland (now Berezhany, Ukraine). Around 1,180 Jews are led to the city's old Jewish graveyard and shot.
Events.html: Holocaust: Germany liquidates the Jewish Ghetto in Brzeżany, Poland (now Berezhany, Ukraine). Around 1,180 Jews are led to the city's old Jewish graveyard and shot.

Events.text: American paratroopers of the 101st Airborne Division secure the town of Carentan.
Events.html: American paratroopers of the 101st Airborne Division secure the town of Carentan.

Events.text: Pope Pius XII canonises Dominic Savio, who was 14 years old at the time of his death, as a saint, making him at the time the youngest unmartyred saint in the Roman Catholic Church. In 2017 Jacinta and Francisco Marto, aged 10 and 9 at the time of their deaths, are declared saints.
Events.html: Pope Pius XII canonises Dominic Savio, who was 14 years old at the time of his death, as a saint, making him at the time the youngest unmartyred saint in the Roman Catholic Church. In 2017 Jacinta and Francisco Marto, aged 10 and 9 at the time of their deaths, are declared saints.

Events.text: NAACP field secretary Medgar Evers is murdered in front of his home in Jackson, Mississippi by Ku Klux Klan member Byron De La Beckwith during the Civil Rights Movement.
Events.html: NAACP field secretary Medgar Evers is murdered in front of his home in Jackson, Mississippi by Ku Klux Klan member Byron De La Beckwith during the Civil Rights Movement.

links.title: National Association for the Advancement of Colored People

Events.text: Anti-apartheid activist and ANC leader Nelson Mandela is sentenced to life in prison for sabotage in South Africa.
Events.html: Anti-apartheid activist and ANC leader Nelson Mandela is sentenced to life in prison for sabotage in South Africa.

Events.text: The United States Supreme Court in Loving v. Virginia declares all U.S. state laws which prohibit interracial marriage to be unconstitutional.
Events.html: The United States Supreme Court in Loving v. Virginia declares all U.S. state laws which prohibit interracial marriage to be unconstitutional.

links.title: Supreme Court of the United States

Events.text: Bryan Allen wins the second Kremer prize for a man powered flight across the English Channel in the Gossamer Albatross.
Events.html: Bryan Allen wins the second Kremer prize for a man powered flight across the English Channel in the Gossamer Albatross.

Events.text: The Central African Republic's former Emperor Jean-Bédel Bokassa is sentenced to death for crimes he had committed during his 13-year rule.
Events.html: The Central African Republic's former Emperor Jean-Bédel Bokassa is sentenced to death for crimes he had committed during his 13-year rule.

Events.text: Cold War: At the Brandenburg Gate U.S. President Ronald Reagan publicly challenges Mikhail Gorbachev to tear down the Berlin Wall.
Events.html: 1987 – Cold War: At the Brandenburg Gate U.S. President Ronald Reagan publicly challenges Mikhail Gorbachev to tear down the Berlin Wall.

Events.text: Russia Day: The parliament of the Russian Federation formally declares its sovereignty.
Events.html: Russia Day: The parliament of the Russian Federation formally declares its sovereignty.

Events.text: Russians first democratically elected Boris Yeltsin as the President of Russia.
Events.html: Russians first democratically elected Boris Yeltsin as the President of Russia.

Events.text: 1991 Kokkadichcholai massacre: The Sri Lankan Army massacres 152 minority Tamil civilians in the village of Kokkadichcholai near the eastern province town of Batticaloa.
Events.html: 1991 – 1991 Kokkadichcholai massacre: The Sri Lankan Army massacres 152 minority Tamil civilians in the village of Kokkadichcholai near the eastern province town of Batticaloa.

Events.text: An election takes place in Nigeria which is later annulled by the military Government led by Ibrahim Babangida.
Events.html: An election takes place in Nigeria which is later annulled by the military Government led by Ibrahim Babangida.

Events.text: Nicole Brown Simpson and Ron Goldman are murdered outside Simpson's home in Los Angeles. Her estranged husband, O.J. Simpson is later charged with the murders, but is acquitted by a jury.
Events.html: Nicole Brown Simpson and Ron Goldman are murdered outside Simpson's home in Los Angeles. Her estranged husband, O.J. Simpson is later charged with the murders, but is acquitted by a jury.

Events.text: Queen Elizabeth II reopens the Globe Theatre in London.
Events.html: Queen Elizabeth II reopens the Globe Theatre in London.

Events.text: Kosovo War: Operation Joint Guardian begins when a NATO-led United Nations peacekeeping force (KFor) enters the province of Kosovo in Federal Republic of Yugoslavia.
Events.html: Kosovo War: Operation Joint Guardian begins when a NATO-led United Nations peacekeeping force (KFor) enters the province of Kosovo in Federal Republic of Yugoslavia.

Events.text: A disputed presidential election in Iran leads to wide-ranging local and international protests.
Events.html: A disputed presidential election in Iran leads to wide-ranging local and international protests.

Events.text: Forty-nine civilians are killed and 58 others injured in an attack on a gay nightclub in Orlando, Florida; the gunman, Omar Mateen, is killed in a gunfight with police.
Events.html: Forty-nine civilians are killed and 58 others injured in an attack on a gay nightclub in Orlando, Florida; the gunman, Omar Mateen, is killed in a gunfight with police.
